intro: Kneiffia pratensis, commonly known as the meadow kniphofia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like leaves and striking spikes of bright orange or red flowers. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and full sun. It is often found in grasslands and along streambanks, contributing to the biodiversity of these habitats. Kneiffia pratensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
